item.title: Getting Started
item.description: Getting Started # This page is meant to get you acquinted with Bert Available Features # Bert comes with a wide array of features such as: Booking Time in the Beta Lab Completing Trainings Checking Tool Availability …and much more! For a full list, select the Features tab in the menu. Logging In # When you first open Bert, you will be redirected to a Google Oauth2 Login Page

item.title: Booking the Lab
item.description: Booking the Lab # Learn how to reserve space in the Beta Lab. IMPORTANT: If you plan to reserve tools, materials or storage you must reserve through Bert. Book Through Google Calendar # There are three distinct Google Calendars for each area of the lab: Classroom Area Power Tool Area Machine Shop Clicking the links above will add them to your Google Calendar where you can view their upcoming and past events.

item.title: FAQ
item.description: FAQ - Frequently Asked Questions # What is Bert? # Bert (or the Beta Lab Resource Tool) is a site devoted to helping Berkeley Carroll teachers and students leverage tools, materials and space available in the Beta Lab. What is the Beta Lab? # The Berkeley Carroll Beta Lab is a 2000 square foot, two-level STEAM lab, providing the space, equipment and expertise for Middle and Upper School teachers and students to meaningfully explore the connections between science, technology, engineering, art and math through complex labs and student-directed projects.

item.title: For Teachers
item.description: Best Practices - For Teachers # Over the years, we have identified some common traits that result in successful projects within the Beta Lab. Whether for MS Science, US Humanities, or independent student work, projects best utilize the lab when they: Have Clear Learning Objectives # As mentioned in the FAQ, there is almost no limit to what you or the students can build in the lab. However, this can make planning a project quite difficult, as the options are limitless.
